title: A Streamable Neural Audio Codec with Residual Scalar-Vector Quantization for Real-Time Communication
author: Xiao-Hang Jiang (University of Science and Technology of China), Yang Ai (University of Science and Technology of China), Rui-Chen Zheng (University of Science and Technology of China), Zhen-Hua Ling (University of Science and Technology of China), ...
relevance_why: The proposed StreamCodec methodology directly relates to audio compression techniques and could enhance Haohe Liu's work in audio generation and processing, particularly in applications requiring efficient real-time communication.
background: Develop a streamable audio codec capable of compressing and transmitting audio data in real-time while maintaining high quality and low latency, using a novel quantization technique.
contribution: This paper introduces StreamCodec, a causal neural audio codec with a residual scalar-vector quantizer to improve audio quality for real-time applications, achieving low latency and efficient generation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Traditional audio codecs often suffer from high latency or low-quality compromises.
technical_comparison.novelty: StreamCodec employs a unique residual scalar-vector quantization strategy that balances efficiency and audio quality, enhancing data utilization and reducing latency.

key_innovation: The combination of scalar and vector quantization in a residual structure effectively captures audio details without high processing overhead.
real_world_impact: The codec provides a practical solution for real-time audio communication applications, significantly improving user experience in video calls and streaming services.
limitations: No specific limitations mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.residual scalar-vector quantization: **Residual scalar-vector quantization** is a technique that sequentially connects simple scalar quantizers and more complex vector quantizers to refine audio data representation progressively.
